definition: ordinary person/private citizen/people/the person in the street
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: We are just ordinary people, why to want to so great.
sentences.chinese: 莪们都只是普通人，何必把自己想旳那么伟大。

sentences.english: They carry it a little further than that.
sentences.chinese: 他们比普通人看的更远一些。

sentences.english: But amid normal people these blandishments have no authority.
sentences.chinese: 不过这种甘言劝诱在普通人中影响力甚微。

sentences.english: Scientists find that hard-working people live longer than average men and women. Career women are healthier than housewives.
sentences.chinese: 科学家发现，努力工作的人要比普通人的寿命长。

sentences.english: It is located on the departmental territory and is inaccessible for ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 这家博物馆位于特殊的部门区域，普通人无法接近。

sentences.english: 'It is a safe bet for the average man on the street, ' Ackman said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，对大街上的普通人来说，这是一种保险的做法。

sentences.english: Huiling believed that persons with mental disabilities should live in society, much the same as ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 慧灵相信智障人士应像普通人一样在社会上生活。

sentences.english: VIP suite with luxury facilities in a star-rated hotel.
sentences.chinese: 普通人住不起五星级饭店的总统套房。

sentences.english: But she insists that they have the opposite of a "rock-and-roll" lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 但她坚持认为他们过着普通人一般的生活。

sentences.english: He is an ordinary - looking man .
Fry Everyman on the network red, it is the one share that the network pushs handiwork to make only.
sentences.chinese: 把普通人在网络上炒红，只是网络推手工作的一部分。

sentences.english: Studies show that the average person experiences paranoia on a daily basis.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明普通人每天都会有一些胡思乱想的体验。

sentences.english: That's when it dawned on Lipson that he wouldn't get to live an average life.
sentences.chinese: 当他不能过普通人的生活时，他就开始做这些事情。

sentences.english: Cmon man have some respect for yourself and your country.
sentences.chinese: 普通人对自己和对自己的国家是会有一些尊敬的。

sentences.english: This made it possible for ordinary people to read the bible and think theologically for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 这使普通人可以阅读圣经并自己进行神学上的思考。

sentences.english: While the politicians ride in limos , ordinary people have no decent transportation.
sentences.chinese: 政客们坐着豪华轿车，普通人却没有象样的交通工具。

definition: proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
at the minimum/at the very least
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
